issue.title: span::cbegin/cend methods produce different results than std::[ranges::]cbegin/cend

discussion.p: span<T> provides a const-qualified begin() method and cbegin() method that produces a different result if T is not const-qualifed:

li.p: begin() produces mutable iterator over T (as if T*)
cbegin() produces const iterator over T (as if T const*)

discussion.p:
As consequence for the object s of type span<T>, the call to the std::cbegin(s)/std::ranges::cbegin(s) produces different result than s.cbegin().
Proposed change:
Change span<T> members cbegin()/cend()/crbegin()/crend()/const_iterator to be equivalent to begin()/end()/rbegin()/rend()/iterator respectively.

Tomasz Kamiński:
Per LEWG discussion in Belfast these methods and related typedefs should be removed.
